poems.title: Bhanu's Love Letter
poems.content:
She read my love letter, I saw a smile on her face,
Blushing with a cute smile, her cheeks were rosy trace.
I had written some beautiful words, for her to embrace,
Her index finger between her teeth, the shyness to erase.

She kisses my letters with her lips,
As though the words in it are helplessly adrift.
My poems are brave and they somehow land on my pages.
While recalling the time when your breath rested on my life stages.

She takes a pen and paper, and begins to write in reply,
She wrote everything she had, letting her emotions fly.
As I start reading her words, tears fill my eyes,
Each word in it made me realize her love is pure and true, it's a love that never dies.

I promise I'll keep you close, you are a treasure I'll always hold,
And the letters, a reminder of the love we share, a story to be told.
For even if distance keeps us apart, and time tries to fade our love,
Our letters will keep our flame burning, like stars shining above.
